intro: Cacalia cuiabensis, commonly known as the Cuiabá bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender stems and produces small, showy blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands.
